00020 #include "NearestNeighborANN.h"

00028 NearestNeighborANN::NearestNeighborANN() {
00029         this->dimension = -1;
00030         this->maxDistance = -1; //default = disable
00031         k = 1;
00032         eps     = 0;
00033         maxPts = 1000;
00034 
00035         dataPoints = 0;
00036         kdTree = 0;
00037 
00038 }
00039 
00040 NearestNeighborANN::~NearestNeighborANN() {
00041         if (kdTree != 0) {
00042                     delete kdTree;
00043         }
00044         if (dataPoints != 0) {
00045                         annDeallocPts(dataPoints);
00046         }
00047         annClose(); // done with ANN
00048 }

00050 void NearestNeighborANN::setData(vector<vector<float> >* data) {
00051         assert(false); //TODO: implement
00052 }
00053 
00054 void NearestNeighborANN::setData(vector<vector<double> >* data) {
00055         assert(data != 0);
00056         assert(data->size() >= 1); // at least one element!
00057 
00058         if (kdTree != 0) {
00059                     delete kdTree;
00060         }
00061         if (dataPoints != 0) {
00062                         annDeallocPts(dataPoints);
00063         }
00064 
00065         dimension = (*data)[0].size();
00066         dataPoints = annAllocPts(data->size(), dimension);                      // allocate data points
00067         int nPts = static_cast<int>(data->size());                                                                      // read data points
00068 
00069         /* fill in the data int the ANN specific representation */
00070         for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(data->size()); ++i) {
00071                 for (int j = 0; j < dimension; ++j) {
00072                         dataPoints[i][j] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( (*data)[i][j] );
00073                 }
00074         }
00075 
00076         kdTree = new ANNkd_tree(                                        // build search structure
00077                                         dataPoints,                                     // the data points
00078                                         nPts,                                           // number of points
00079                                         dimension);                                     // dimension of space
00080 
00081 }
00082 
00083 void NearestNeighborANN::setData(PointCloud3D* data) {
00084         assert(data != 0);
00085 
00086         if (kdTree != 0) {
00087                     delete kdTree;
00088         }
00089         if (dataPoints != 0) {
00090                         annDeallocPts(dataPoints);
00091         }
00092 
00093         dimension = 3; //we work with a 3D points...
00094         dataPoints = annAllocPts(data->getSize(), dimension);                   // allocate data points
00095         int nPts = static_cast<int>(data->getSize());                                                                   // read data points
00096 
00097         /* fill in the data int the ANN specific representation */
00098         for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(data->getSize()); ++i) {
00099                 dataPoints[i][0] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( (*data->getPointCloud())[i].getX() );
00100                 dataPoints[i][1] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( (*data->getPointCloud())[i].getY() );
00101                 dataPoints[i][2] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( (*data->getPointCloud())[i].getZ() );
00102         }
00103 
00104         kdTree = new ANNkd_tree(                                        // build search structure
00105                                         dataPoints,                                     // the data points
00106                                         nPts,                                           // number of points
00107                                         dimension);                                     // dimension of space
00108 
00109 
00110 }

00112 void NearestNeighborANN::findNearestNeighbors(vector<float>* query, std::vector<int>* resultIndices, unsigned int k) {
00113         assert (false); //TODO: implement
00114 }
00115 
00116 void NearestNeighborANN::findNearestNeighbors(vector<double>* query, std::vector<int>* resultIndices, unsigned int k) {
00117         assert (query != 0);
00118         assert (resultIndices != 0);
00119 //      assert (static_cast<int>(query->size()) == dimension);
00120 
00121         if (static_cast<int>(query->size()) != dimension) {
00122                 throw runtime_error("Mismatch of query and data dimension.");
00123         }
00124         if (static_cast<int>(k) > kdTree->nPoints()) {
00125                 throw runtime_error("Number of neighbors k is bigger than the amount of data points.");
00126         }
00127 
00128         this->k = static_cast<int>(k);
00129         resultIndices->clear();
00130 
00131         nnIndex = new ANNidx[k];                                        // allocate near neigh indices
00132         distances = new ANNdist[k];                                     // allocate near neighbor distances
00133         queryPoint = annAllocPt(dimension);                     // allocate query point
00134 
00135         for (int i = 0; i < dimension; ++i) {
00136                 queryPoint[i] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( (*query)[i] );
00137         }
00138 
00139         kdTree->annkSearch(                                             // search
00140                         queryPoint,                                             // query point
00141                         this->k,                                                        // number of near neighbors
00142                         nnIndex,                                                // nearest neighbors (returned)
00143                         distances,                                              // distance (returned)
00144                         eps);                                                   // error bound
00145 
00146         brics_3d::Coordinate resultDistance; //distance has same data-type as Coordinate, although the meaning is different TODO: global distance typedef?
00147         int resultIndex;
00148         for (int i = 0; i < this->k; i++) {
00149                 resultDistance = static_cast<brics_3d::Coordinate>(sqrt(distances[i])); //unsquare distance
00150                 resultIndex = nnIndex[i];
00151                 if (resultDistance <= maxDistance || maxDistance < 0.0) { //if max distance is < 0 then the distance should have no influence
00152                         resultIndices->push_back(resultIndex);
00153                 }
00154         }
00155 
00156         annDeallocPt(queryPoint);                                       // clean things up
00157     delete [] nnIndex;
00158     delete [] distances;
00159 
00160 }
00161 
00162 void NearestNeighborANN::findNearestNeighbors(Point3D* query, std::vector<int>* resultIndices, unsigned int k) {
00163         assert (query != 0);
00164         assert (resultIndices != 0);
00165         assert (dimension == 3);
00166 
00167         if (static_cast<int>(k) > kdTree->nPoints()) {
00168                 throw runtime_error("Number of neighbors k is bigger than the amount of data points.");
00169         }
00170 
00171         this->k = static_cast<int>(k);
00172         resultIndices->clear();
00173 
00174         nnIndex = new ANNidx[k];                                        // allocate near neigh indices
00175         distances = new ANNdist[k];                                     // allocate near neighbor distances
00176         queryPoint = annAllocPt(dimension);                     // allocate query point
00177 
00178         queryPoint[0] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( query->getX() );
00179         queryPoint[1] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( query->getY() );
00180         queryPoint[2] = static_cast<ANNcoord>( query->getZ() );
00181 
00182         kdTree->annkSearch(                                             // search
00183                         queryPoint,                                             // query point
00184                         this->k,                                                        // number of near neighbors
00185                         nnIndex,                                                // nearest neighbors (returned)
00186                         distances,                                              // distance (returned)
00187                         eps);                                                   // error bound
00188 
00189 //      std::cout << "\tNN:\tIndex\tDistance\n";
00190 //      for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {                   // print summary
00191 //              distances[i] = sqrt(distances[i]);                      // unsquare distance
00192 //              std::cout << "\t" << i << "\t" << nnIndex[i] << "\t" << distances[i] << "\n";
00193 //      }
00194 
00195         brics_3d::Coordinate resultDistance; //distance has same data-type as Coordinate, although the meaning is different TODO: global distance typedef?
00196         int resultIndex;
00197         for (int i = 0; i < this->k; i++) {
00198                 resultDistance = static_cast<brics_3d::Coordinate>(sqrt(distances[i])); //unsquare distance
00199                 resultIndex = nnIndex[i];
00200 
00201                 if (resultDistance <= maxDistance || maxDistance < 0.0) { //if max distance is < 0 then the distance should have no influence
00202                         resultIndices->push_back(resultIndex);
00203 
00204                 }
00205         }
00206 
00207 
00208 
00209         annDeallocPt(queryPoint);                                       // clean things up
00210     delete [] nnIndex;
00211     delete [] distances;
00212 
00213 }
